author: Amanda Foreman
title: How Mermaid-Merman Tales Got to This Year’s Oscars
text:
Popular culture is enamored with mermaids. This year’s Best Picture Oscar winner, Guillermo del Toro’s “The Shape of Water,” about a lonely mute woman and a captured amphibious man, is a new take on an old theme. “The Little Mermaid,” Disney’s enormously successful 1989 animated film, was based on the Hans Christian Andersen story of the same name, and it was turned into a Broadway musical, which even now is still being staged across the country.
The fascination with mermythology began with the ancient Greeks. In the beginning,...
